From what I can see, this has never been used, but I wanted  to use it for #12222 . 
The offset of where the input buffer starts seems to be incorrect and overlap with the text already on screen.

This leads to not only the initial value not being displayed on screen, but when you press backspace to remove the value, it removes information from the screen that it shouldn't

# Steps to reproduce

```c#
var WriteToConsole("Enter value: ")
var result = ReadLine(false, "default", out _, true, true);
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Enter value: default
```
Press backspace enough to remove value
```none
Enter value: 
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Enter value:
```
You still have to press backspace enough to remove the default:
```none
Enter 
```
